description: Dive into "Coastal Escapes: Beaches of The Hague" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Coastal Escapes: Beaches of The Hague

places.generalDescription: Westduinpark, located between Scheveningen and Kijkduin in The Hague, is a vast nature reserve known for its diverse landscape of forests, open plains, moist dune valleys, and elevated dune tops. This sea-facing park offers hiking and biking opportunities amid sand dunes and heather. It is popular with runners, dog owners, and families who can encounter Highland cows and other herd animals while exploring the area.

sources.snippet: Freewheeling on my bicycle on a recent ride through Westduinpark ‚Äì a vast area of sand dunes which runs along The Hague‚Äôs coastline ‚Äì I took a deep lungful of fresh spring air, scented with hawthorn and heather. Soon summer would arrive, and the area would flush yellow with evening primrose. I paused a while to watch kite-surfers zip neatly across the North Sea and huge white wind-turbines whirring like pinwheels on the horizon, then pedalled onwards to spread my towel on the soft, golden Blue Flag sands.
sources.shortName: Forget Barcelona ‚Äì The Hague is Europe's best beach city

sources.snippet: A fine walk through the beautiful dunes should without a doubt be part of your visit to The Hague beach. Westduinpark is located between Scheveningen and Kijkduin. The varied landscape of high dunes, deep valleys and abandoned Second World War bunkers is very interesting to see.
sources.shortName: Scheveningen, The Netherlands: visit The Hague Beach

sources.snippet: People who love uncommon animals will enjoy visiting the Westduinpark nature reserve to spot the magnificent Scottish Highland cattle. It‚Äôs also a particularly wonderful place for a nice walk. Read more ondenhaag.com
sources.shortName: The Hague: sights, beaches, museums, the Binnenhof and more!

sources.snippet: You are free to sunbathe completely naked at Zwarte Pad, Noordestrand Scheveningen, Westduinpark, and Zuiderstrand Scheveningen, Laan van Poot access point.
sources.shortName: Scheveningen in The Hague (Best Things to Expect

sources.snippet: Westduin Park is one of The Hague's largest nature reserves. It connects Kijkduin to Scheveningen. Many protected plant and animal species live in the area.

places.name: Westduinpark

reviews.text: A fantastic place to walk and enjoy the sea. The cows are absolutely cute. Very clean with great walking paths and small hills with panoramic view.

Very nice nature reserve, offering a lot of different trails through the sand dunes or  to the beach. Can be crowded in the weekends. Be aware with Google maps. A lot of walking trails on Google go through closed areas, where you are not allowed to walk.
Pretty beautiful place. You can walk around or take a tour with a bike.

places.generalDescription: De Pier in Den Haag, also known as Scheveningen Pier, is a popular recreational spot with both enclosed and open-air decks. It offers a variety of casual restaurants and thrilling activities like bungee jumping. The pier provides an enjoyable experience for visitors, combining leisurely strolls with attractions and dining options. Situated on the Scheveningen boulevard, it serves as a charming location to relax while enjoying scenic views of the North Sea.

sources.shortName: Scheveningen The Hague, the grand lady of Dutch Beaches

places.name: De Pier. La Haya

reviews.text: Amazing spot to visit. The pier itself has a massive selection of stuff to eat and do ranging from trampoline park to bungee jumping over the water. We rode the Ferris wheel and it was definitely worth the price - great views and nice long ride. Also the entire area around the pier is lively and vibrant with many vendors and people to see. This area is a must visit when in the area!

Great area to wander around, enjoy some people-watching and refresh in the sea. The beach is (oder course) very crowded. All around De Pier are a lot of souvenir shops, restaurants, bars and ice cream shops, so no one has to leave thirsty or hungry. The Big Wheel is a highlight, enjoy watching it while having a drink in De Pier own bars inside (very warm!) or from the top of De Pier. Courageous people can also do the Bungee Jump or the zip line.

‚≠ê De Pier ‚Äì A must-visit by the sea!

Absolutely loved my time at De Pier! üåä
Beautiful views of the North Sea, cool ocean breeze, and a lively boardwalk full of food, drinks, and fun activities. Whether you're looking to relax, take amazing photos, or just enjoy a nice walk over the water ‚Äì this place is perfect.

Bonus: there's even a bungee jump and Ferris wheel for thrill-seekers! üé°
Great spot to spend an afternoon ‚Äì highly recommended!

sources.snippet: Kijkduin Beach is the other favorite of locals in the Hague and my favorite as well!. A while ago, I had stayed overnight at the HaagseStrandhuisjes, picturesque beach cottages directly in the sand where you can wake up to the sound of the ocean. Kijkduin feels untouched compared to Scheveningen and I loved the feeling of having the sunset as well as the sunrise to myself.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in the Hague to visit by a local
Things To Do In The Hague

reviews.text: Very nice an calm and clean beach, recommend visiting here and of course do not forget sunscreen. Enjoy your time in peaceful surroundings and have fun with your family and friends.

Strand Kijkduin is a long, wide sandy beach very close to The Hague, perfect for a relaxed day by the sea. On sunny days it gets busy, but there's still lots of space to enjoy the sand and water. It's a fun place to meet friends, go for a walk, or just unwind. The many restaurants and caf√©s along the promenade add to the atmosphere and make it easy to spend a whole day here.

A Serene Oasis with a Few Surprises!

Strand Kijkduin is an absolute treasure along the Netherlands' coastline. It offered a unique and refreshing experience that exceeded my expectations in many ways.

The spaciousness of this beach, combined with low crowd density, creates an atmosphere of pure serenity. If you're seeking peace and tranquility, you'll find it here.

One standout feature of Strand Kijkduin is the abundance of restaurants and bars that line the shore. Whether you're craving Dutch delights or international cuisine, there's something to please every palate. The quality of the food is impressive, and dining with a view of the sea is an unforgettable experience.

I must admit that, as a Mediterranean person, I had different expectations for the sea. While it might not have the vibrant blue waters I'm used to, it still provides a pleasant and refreshing dip on a warm day.

The availability of a nearby supermarket is a huge convenience. It's perfect for stocking up on essentials and snacks without the need to venture far from the beach.

Now, let's talk about those sunbeds and umbrellas. While they do come with a price tag (10 euros for sunbeds and 7 euros for umbrellas), the comfort and shade they offer are well worth it. It's a small indulgence that enhances the overall beach experience.

One small caveat is the parking situation. While there is a free car parking spot nearby, finding an empty space can be a bit of a challenge. Be prepared for a hunt or consider alternative transportation options.

In conclusion, Strand Kijkduin is a hidden gem that I highly recommend. It offers tranquility, fantastic dining options, and the convenience of a nearby supermarket. Despite my initial reservations about the sea, the overall experience deserves a solid five out of five stars. It's a beach that has something for everyone to enjoy!

places.generalDescription: Scheveningen is a picturesque coastal town in The Hague, offering a delightful mix of marine scenery and vibrant attractions. Visitors can explore the bustling harbor with its industrial fishing companies, trawlers, smoke houses, and fish mongers. The area also features a full swing yacht harbor along with numerous eateries, restaurants, specialized shops, and upscale clothing stores. Additionally, the town boasts a stunning beach where visitors can take leisurely strolls while enjoying beautiful views of the water and boats.

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll soon come to Scheveningen Harbour, packed with fish restaurants to suit all budgets, from stands selling Hollandse Nieuwe ‚Äì raw herrings pickled with onions ‚Äì to fine-dining at Catch, owned by the Simoni family since the late 19th century. For a traditional lunch, order the kabeljauw (cod) at Restaurant De Dagvisser, served in true Dutch style with frites and mayonnaise.
sources.shortName: Forget Barcelona ‚Äì The Hague is Europe's best beach city

places.name: Scheveningen

reviews.text: Best place on the world:)

The Harbor is a must see if you like the marine scenery.It has an interesting mix of industrial fishing companies and their trawlers, smoke houses and fish mongers.A full swing yacht harbor and this area is scattered with lots of eateries, restaurants , specialized shops and upmarket clothing.On walking distance the beach for taking a stroll.It's this combination that will gives you the truly marine vibes in a pleasant way.You can't go wrong here!
Here you can find a good sugardaddy with a boat. ‚úåüèª

sources.snippet: By the time you‚Äôve pedalled back to Kijkduin, the afternoon will be wearing on, so embrace the Dutch concept of niksen (the art of doing nothing) at Otrobanda beach club, a cosy bar that channels the Dutch Caribbean island of Curacao. Settle down, order a beer and some seafood and, if you‚Äôre lucky with the weather, it might seem hard to believe you‚Äôre just 100 miles off the Suffolk coast.
sources.shortName: Forget Barcelona ‚Äì The Hague is Europe's best beach city

places.name: Otrobanda Beach

reviews.text: We had a great experience with the food at Otrobanda Beach. The staff were incredibly friendly and took care of our special requests regarding gluten-free food and various allergies in an uncomplicated and competent manner, so that we always felt safe in this regard. The food was of very good quality and every dish was very tasty. The ambience and the location on the beach with a sea view are absolutely beautiful and tasteful. Highly recommended!

Lovely chill place with plenty of seats available on the sunny day we visited. Staff is kind and customer focused. It's a short walk from where you enter the beach. But definitely worth it as it's much less crowded than the beach clubs at the beach entrance.

Super relaxed place. Goat cheese, olive, pesto, honey, wallnut sandwich is AWESOME. It's so richly endowed that I ask for 1 or 2 extra slices of bread, because there's so much. Nice and cozy place, nice staff. Really enjoy coming here. Only down side to me is that there are dogs allowed, but that's different to anyone.

places.address: Strand Zuid 21, 2554 ZZ Den Haag, Netherlands

places.generalDescription: Meijendel is a nature reserve near Scheveningen, offering a peaceful escape from the beach with marked walking trails and cycling paths. The area is home to friendly Konik horses and provides plenty of shade in the pine forest. With over 200 bird species and diverse wildlife including rabbits, bats, foxes, weasels, and deer, it's an oasis of biodiversity.

sources.snippet: About 1km east of the pier (look for signs leading to the LF1-B or point 39), a brick water tower marks the entry to Meijendel, an 1875-hectare nature reserve. Both casual cyclists and racers follow a maroon brick road through the reserve, climbing then cruising roller-coaster style alongside yellowish hills studded with low wiry trees and brownish shrubs. Observation points afford sweeping views of the dunes and lagoons, and there are beach turnoffs along the way.
sources.shortName: Summer in Den Haag: a guide to South Holland's beaches

sources.snippet: This nature reserve is a lovely area to ride bikes or walk if you‚Äôd like a few hours away from the beach. Easily reached from Scheveningen, the dunes are home to many friendly ‚ÄòKonik‚Äô horses. Meijendel is also a good idea for what to do on a hot day in the Hague, with pine forest providing plenty of shade.
sources.shortName: Best beach day ideas in The Hague

sources.snippet: Meijendel is the largest interconnected dune area in the province of South Holland. The beautiful nature reserve stretches between Scheveningen, The Hague and Wassenaar. It‚Äôs a splendid place for a brisk walk or bicycle ride.
sources.shortName: The Hague: sights, beaches, museums, the Binnenhof and more!

places.name: Meijendel

reviews.text: Lovely cycling area!! Nice nature and peaceful environment and trees üå≤

A beautiful large park with both dunes and forestry, you can find shade and nice walking paths but at the same time the sun and sand if that's what you like. The farm and restaurant is okay and there are facilities for kids which is great. All in all a nice park.
Very nice stop within the dunes of Scheveningen. Nice food. Nice atmosphere.

Nice and quietl
Was more people at 16:00, towards 20:00 pretty empty
Beautiful Beach... It's so peaceful and calm , sit and enjoy the water waves....
The beach is clean, there is no crowd, and all the people are nice

sources.snippet: This beach hidden behind Westduinpark is often one of the quieter beaches in the Hague as people don‚Äôt often realize how lovely this is. Another plus of this beach is that the studio of famed Hague artist Theo Janssen is nearby and you often see him on the beach testing out his creations in the summer. It‚Äôs a favorite of a few people that I‚Äôve met that still love to walk on the beach, but prefer to have it to themselves.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in the Hague to visit by a local

reviews.text: Don't confuse the ‚Äústrandslag‚Äù with the ‚Äústrand tent‚Äù - the first being the access road to the beach through the dunes, the latter being the beach shack where you can eat and drink.
Beach is way better than Scheveningen. Food is nice, but the staff was simply too busy to care about you.
Beautiful place :)
